bibl.title: Between Water and Sand. Agriculture and Husbandry.
bibl.note: The state and the land: The agro-fiscal management of Roman Egypt: Private and public land; - cereals land, orchards, and gardens; - from dry to flooded. - Land use and food production. - Sacred landscapes: The case of Hatmehyt. - Conclusion.

bibl.title: The Oxford Handbook of Roman Egypt.

bibl.seg: Blouin Katherine, Between Water and Sand. Agriculture and Husbandry.
Christina Riggs (Ed.), The Oxford Handbook of Roman Egypt (Oxford, 2012) pp. 22-37, 3 tabl.

The state and the land: The agro-fiscal management of Roman Egypt: Private and public land; - cereals land, orchards, and gardens; - from dry to flooded. - Land use and food production. - Sacred landscapes: The case of Hatmehyt. - Conclusion.
